title: Potion of cancellation
data:
***Version [0.29](/0.29 "0.29")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

| Type | Potion                                                                                                     |
| :--- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Name | Potion of cancellation                                                                                     |
| Icon | [![Potion of cancellation.png](/images/0/08/Potion_of_cancellation.png)](/File:Potion_of_cancellation.png) |

|   |                                                                                                                            |
| - | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | A potion which ends most magical effects, good or bad, affecting one who drinks it. It also reduces magical contamination. |

Quaffing a **potion of cancellation** immediately ends nearly all [status effects](/Status_effects "Status effects") you may be enjoying/suffering from. It also removes 1000-5000 points of [magic contamination](/Magic_contamination "Magic contamination"). The potion's description lists all your current status effects that can be removed by the potion.

## Contents

- [1 Dispellable Effects](#Dispellable_Effects)

  - [1.1 The Bad](#The_Bad)
  - [1.2 The Good](#The_Good)
  - [1.3 Resistant Status Effects](#Resistant_Status_Effects)
  - [1.4 Monster Status Effects](#Monster_Status_Effects)

- [2 Unaffected Status Effects](#Unaffected_Status_Effects)

  - [2.1 The Bad](#The_Bad_2)
  - [2.2 The Good](#The_Good_2)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 References](#References)

## Dispellable Effects

These are also the effects that can be ended from [Quicksilver Bolt](/Quicksilver_Bolt "Quicksilver Bolt") (including the [wand of quicksilver](/Wand_of_quicksilver "Wand of quicksilver")) and [Yara's Violent Unravelling](/Yara%27s_Violent_Unravelling "Yara's Violent Unravelling"). The list of all affected [status effects](/Status_effect "Status effect") is as follows:[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

### The Bad

- Many action disabling effects:

  - [Bad forms](/Bad_form "Bad form")
  - -[Blink](/Blink "Blink")
  - [Confusion](/Confusion "Confusion")
  - [Dimension Anchor](/Dimension_Anchor "Dimension Anchor") (-Tele)
  - [Fear](/Cause_Fear "Cause Fear")
  - [Mesmerised](/Mesmerise "Mesmerise")
  - [Locked Down](/Miscast_effects "Miscast effects") (Stuck)
  - [Petrifying](/Petrify "Petrify")
  - [Silence](/Silence "Silence") (when used on the source of the aura; e.g. the potion works if you cast the spell, but not if an enemy cast the spell)

- Many debuffs:

  - [Corona](/Corona "Corona")
  - [Corroded](/Acid#Corrosion "Acid")
  - [Slow](/Slow "Slow")
  - [Vertigo](/Vertigo "Vertigo")
  - [Weakness](/Weak "Weak")
  - [Frozen](/Frozen "Frozen")

- Elemental [vulnerabilities](/Vulnerability "Vulnerability"):

  - [Fire](/Fire "Fire") vulnerability (rF-)
  - [Strip Willpower](/Strip_Willpower "Strip Willpower") (Will-)
  - [Virulence](/Virulence "Virulence") (rPois-)
  - [Weak-willed](/Scroll_of_vulnerability "Scroll of vulnerability") (Will 1/2)

- Other effects:

  - [Flayed](/Flayed_ghost "Flayed ghost")
  - [Howl](/Doom_hound "Doom hound")
  - [Sap Magic](/Sap_Magic "Sap Magic")
  - [Sentinel's Mark](/Sentinel%27s_Mark "Sentinel's Mark")
  - [Sticky Flame](/Sticky_Flame "Sticky Flame") (Fire)

### The Good

- [Teleporting](/Teleport "Teleport")

- Most effects available from [potions](/Potion "Potion"), excluding [berserk](/Berserk "Berserk"):

  - [Attraction](/Potion_of_attraction "Potion of attraction")
  - [Ambrosia](/Potion_of_ambrosia "Potion of ambrosia")
  - [Brilliance](/Brilliance "Brilliance")
  - [Haste](/Haste "Haste")
  - [Invisible](/Invisible "Invisible")
  - [Might](/Might "Might")
  - [Resistance](/Resistance "Resistance")
  - [Agility](/Agility "Agility") (formerly from a [potion](/Potion_of_agility "Potion of agility"))

- [Necromancy](/Necromancy "Necromancy") spells:

  - [Animate Dead](/Animate_Dead "Animate Dead")
  - [Death Channel](/Death_Channel "Death Channel")

- Certain other spells:

  - [Confusing Touch](/Confusing_Touch "Confusing Touch")
  - [Disjunction](/Disjunction "Disjunction")
  - [Liquefying](/Leda%27s_Liquefaction "Leda's Liquefaction")
  - [Olgreb's Toxic Radiance](/Olgreb%27s_Toxic_Radiance "Olgreb's Toxic Radiance")
  - [Ozocubu's Armour](/Ozocubu%27s_Armour "Ozocubu's Armour")
  - [Portal Projectile](/Portal_Projectile "Portal Projectile")
  - [Swiftness](/Swiftness "Swiftness")
  - [Wereblood](/Wereblood "Wereblood")

### Resistant Status Effects

Rather than being dispelled outright, these status effects will have their duration set to 1 turn.

- [Flight](/Flight "Flight")
- All [Transmutations](/Transmutations "Transmutations") not listed above

### Monster Status Effects

These statuses can be cancelled normally, but are either exclusive to monsters, or a player wouldn't be able to act while in the status (where a monster's [Quicksilver Bolt](/Quicksilver_Bolt "Quicksilver Bolt") can end it).

- [Antimagic](/Antimagic "Antimagic") (only a status for monsters)
- [Bind Souls](/Bind_Souls "Bind Souls"), [Simulacrum](/Simulacrum "Simulacrum")
- [Inner Flame](/Inner_Flame "Inner Flame")
- [Repel Missiles](/Repel_Missiles "Repel Missiles")
- [Word of Recall](/Word_of_Recall "Word of Recall")
- [Paralysis](/Paralysis "Paralysis")
- [Petrified](/Petrify "Petrify")
- [Sleep](/Sleep "Sleep")

## Unaffected Status Effects

### The Bad

- [Draining](/Draining "Draining")

- [Barbs](/Barbs "Barbs")

- No Potions / No Scrolls

- [Poison](/Poison "Poison")

- Action cooldowns:

  - -[Berserk](/Berserk "Berserk")
  - -[DDoor](/Death%27s_Door "Death's Door")
  - [Exhaustion](/Exhaustion "Exhaustion")
  - -[Hop](/Barachi "Barachi")

### The Good

- [Berserk](/Berserk "Berserk")
- [Death's Door](/Death%27s_Door "Death's Door")
- [Dragon's Call](/Dragon%27s_Call "Dragon's Call")
- [Maxwell's Capacitive Coupling](/Maxwell%27s_Capacitive_Coupling "Maxwell's Capacitive Coupling") (though it ends if you do anything but wait)
- [Powered By Death](/Powered_By_Death "Powered By Death")
- [Polar Vortex](/Polar_Vortex "Polar Vortex")
- [Quad Damage](/Thunderdome#Quad_damage "Thunderdome")
- All [god](/God "God")-granted status effects

## Strategy

Potions of cancellation are rare, but quite useful. It can remove many dangerous status effects, such as [Petrify](/Petrify "Petrify"). [Mark](/Mark "Mark"), and [bad forms](/Bad_form "Bad form"). It can also remove contamination in a pinch.

Note that cancellation will also remove many useful statuses, such as Haste and Tele, so be careful. This makes monsters with Quicksilver Bolt some of the more dangerous foes in the game.

Potions of cancellation aren't common, so try to conserve them if you can afford to. The following statuses may be ended via other sources:

- [Confusion](/Confusion "Confusion") - quaffing a [potion of curing](/Potion_of_curing "Potion of curing")
- [Teleport](/Teleport "Teleport") - reading another [scroll of teleportation](/Scroll_of_teleportation "Scroll of teleportation")
- [Slow](/Slow "Slow") - negated by [haste](/Haste "Haste")

## History

- The list of the cancellable effects was added to the potion's description in [0.27](/0.27 "0.27").
- Potions of cancellation were added in [0.15](/0.15 "0.15"), partially taking the role of [scrolls of vulnerability](/Scrolls_of_vulnerability "Scrolls of vulnerability").

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [duration-data.h:L159](https://github.com/crawl/crawl/blob/0.29.0/crawl-ref/source/duration-data.h#LL159) (0.29.0)

| [Potions](/Potion "Potion")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [Ambrosia](/Potion_of_ambrosia "Potion of ambrosia") • [Attraction](/Potion_of_attraction "Potion of attraction") • [Berserk rage](/Potion_of_berserk_rage "Potion of berserk rage") • [Brilliance](/Potion_of_brilliance "Potion of brilliance") • [Cancellation]() • [Curing](/Potion_of_curing "Potion of curing") • [Degeneration](/Potion_of_degeneration "Potion of degeneration") • [Enlightenment](/Potion_of_enlightenment "Potion of enlightenment") • [Experience](/Potion_of_experience "Potion of experience") • [Haste](/Potion_of_haste "Potion of haste") • [Heal wounds](/Potion_of_heal_wounds "Potion of heal wounds") • [Invisibility](/Potion_of_invisibility "Potion of invisibility") • [Lignification](/Potion_of_lignification "Potion of lignification") • [Magic](/Potion_of_magic "Potion of magic") • [Might](/Potion_of_might "Potion of might") • [Mutation](/Potion_of_mutation "Potion of mutation") • [Resistance](/Potion_of_resistance "Potion of resistance") |
html:
Potion of cancellation

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.29: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.
Type Potion
Name Potion of cancellation
Icon
A potion which ends most magical effects, good or bad, affecting one who drinks it. It also reduces magical contamination.

Quaffing a potion of cancellation immediately ends nearly all status effects you may be enjoying/suffering from. It also removes 1000-5000 points of magic contamination. The potion's description lists all your current status effects that can be removed by the potion.

Contents

  • 1 Dispellable Effects
    • 1.1 The Bad
    • 1.2 The Good
    • 1.3 Resistant Status Effects
    • 1.4 Monster Status Effects
  • 2 Unaffected Status Effects
    • 2.1 The Bad
    • 2.2 The Good
  • 3 Strategy
  • 4 History
  • 5 References

Dispellable Effects

These are also the effects that can be ended from Quicksilver Bolt (including the wand of quicksilver) and Yara's Violent Unravelling. The list of all affected status effects is as follows:[1]

The Bad

  • Many action disabling effects:
    • Bad forms
    • -Blink
    • Confusion
    • Dimension Anchor (-Tele)
    • Fear
    • Mesmerised
    • Locked Down (Stuck)
    • Petrifying
    • Silence (when used on the source of the aura; e.g. the potion works if you cast the spell, but not if an enemy cast the spell)
  • Many debuffs:
    • Corona
    • Corroded
    • Slow
    • Vertigo
    • Weakness
    • Frozen
  • Elemental vulnerabilities:
    • Fire vulnerability (rF-)
    • Strip Willpower (Will-)
    • Virulence (rPois-)
    • Weak-willed (Will 1/2)
  • Other effects:
    • Flayed
    • Howl
    • Sap Magic
    • Sentinel's Mark
    • Sticky Flame (Fire)

The Good

  • Teleporting
  • Most effects available from potions, excluding berserk:
    • Attraction
    • Ambrosia
    • Brilliance
    • Haste
    • Invisible
    • Might
    • Resistance
    • Agility (formerly from a potion)
  • Necromancy spells:
    • Animate Dead
    • Death Channel
  • Certain other spells:
    • Confusing Touch
    • Disjunction
    • Liquefying
    • Olgreb's Toxic Radiance
    • Ozocubu's Armour
    • Portal Projectile
    • Swiftness
    • Wereblood

Resistant Status Effects

Rather than being dispelled outright, these status effects will have their duration set to 1 turn.

  • Flight
  • All Transmutations not listed above

Monster Status Effects

These statuses can be cancelled normally, but are either exclusive to monsters, or a player wouldn't be able to act while in the status (where a monster's Quicksilver Bolt can end it).

  • Antimagic (only a status for monsters)
  • Bind Souls, Simulacrum
  • Inner Flame
  • Repel Missiles
  • Word of Recall
  • Paralysis
  • Petrified
  • Sleep

Unaffected Status Effects

The Bad

  • Draining
  • Barbs
  • No Potions / No Scrolls
  • Poison
  • Action cooldowns:
    • -Berserk
    • -DDoor
    • Exhaustion
    • -Hop

The Good

  • Berserk
  • Death's Door
  • Dragon's Call
  • Maxwell's Capacitive Coupling (though it ends if you do anything but wait)
  • Powered By Death
  • Polar Vortex
  • Quad Damage
  • All god-granted status effects

Strategy

Potions of cancellation are rare, but quite useful. It can remove many dangerous status effects, such as Petrify. Mark, and bad forms. It can also remove contamination in a pinch.

Note that cancellation will also remove many useful statuses, such as Haste and Tele, so be careful. This makes monsters with Quicksilver Bolt some of the more dangerous foes in the game.

Potions of cancellation aren't common, so try to conserve them if you can afford to. The following statuses may be ended via other sources:

  • Confusion - quaffing a potion of curing
  • Teleport - reading another scroll of teleportation
  • Slow - negated by haste

History

  • The list of the cancellable effects was added to the potion's description in 0.27.
  • Potions of cancellation were added in 0.15, partially taking the role of scrolls of vulnerability.

References

  1. ↑ duration-data.h:L159 (0.29.0)

Quaffing a '''potion of cancellation''' immediately ends nearly all [[status effects]] you may be enjoying/suffering from. It also removes 1000-5000 points of [[magic contamination]]. The potion's description lists all your current status effects that can be removed by the potion.

==Dispellable Effects==
These are also the effects that can be ended from [[Quicksilver Bolt]] (including the [[wand of quicksilver]]) and [[Yara's Violent Unravelling]]. The list of all affected [[status effect]]s is as follows:<ref>{{source ref|0.29.0|duration-data.h|L159}}</ref> 

===The Bad===
*Many action disabling effects:
**[[Bad form]]s
**-[[Blink]]
**[[Confusion]]
**[[Dimension Anchor]] (-Tele)
**[[Cause Fear|Fear]]
**[[Mesmerise]]d

*Other effects:

===The Good===

*Most effects available from [[potion]]s, excluding [[berserk]]:
**[[Potion of attraction|Attraction]]

**[[Brilliance]]

===Resistant Status Effects===
Rather than being dispelled outright, these status effects will have their duration set to 1 turn.
*[[Flight]]
*All [[Transmutations]] not listed above

===Monster Status Effects===
These statuses can be cancelled normally, but are either exclusive to monsters, or a player wouldn't be able to act while in the status (where a monster's [[Quicksilver Bolt]] can end it).

*[[Antimagic]] (only a status for monsters)
*[[Bind Souls]], [[Simulacrum]]
*[[Inner Flame]]
*[[Repel Missiles]]
*[[Word of Recall]]
*[[Paralysis]]

==Unaffected Status Effects==
===The Bad===
*[[Draining]]
*[[Barbs]]
*No Potions / No Scrolls

**-[[Berserk]]

===The Good===

*[[Death's Door]]
*[[Dragon's Call]]
*[[Maxwell's Capacitive Coupling]] (though it ends if you do anything but wait)
*[[Powered By Death]]
*[[Polar Vortex]]
*[[Thunderdome#Quad damage|Quad Damage]]
*All [[god]]-granted status effects

==Strategy==
Potions of cancellation are rare, but quite useful. It can remove many dangerous status effects, such as [[Petrify]]. [[Mark]], and [[bad form]]s. It can also remove contamination in a pinch.

Note that cancellation will also remove many useful statuses, such as Haste and Tele, so be careful. This makes monsters with Quicksilver Bolt some of the more dangerous foes in the game.

Potions of cancellation aren't common, so try to conserve them if you can afford to. The following statuses may be ended via other sources:
*[[Confusion]] - quaffing a [[potion of curing]]
*[[Teleport]] - reading another [[scroll of teleportation]]
*[[Slow]] - negated by [[haste]]

==History==
*The list of the cancellable effects was added to the potion's description in [[0.27]].
*Potions of cancellation were added in [[0.15]], partially taking the role of [[scrolls of vulnerability]].
